title: PROPOSALS FOR
text: GENERAL MANDATES TO ISSUE SHARES AND REPURCHASE SHARES, RE-ELECTION OF RETIRING DIRECTORS AND

title: NOTICE OF ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING
The purpose of this circular is to provide you with the notice of Annual General Meeting and
text: the following proposals to be put forward at the Annual General Meeting, among other matters, (a)

title: granting of the General Mandate to issue Shares and the Repurchase Mandate to repurchase
text: Shares; and (b) the re-election of retiring Directors.

title: GENERAL MANDATE TO ISSUE SHARES
text: At the annual general meeting of the Company held on May 20, 2024, an ordinary resolution

title: was passed granting a general mandate to the Directors to issue new Shares up to a maximum of
text: 20% of the total number of the issued Shares as at the date of passing such resolution. Such mandate will lapse at the conclusion of the Annual General Meeting. In order to ensure flexibility and give discretion to the Directors, in the event that it becomes desirable for the Company to issue any new Shares (including any sale or transfer of treasury Shares), approval is to be sought from the Shareholders, pursuant to the Listing Rules, for the General Mandate to issue Shares. At the Annual General Meeting, an ordinary resolution numbered 4(A) will be proposed to grant the General Mandate to the Directors to exercise the powers of the Company to allot, issue and deal with the additional Shares (including any sale or transfer of treasury Shares) not exceeding 20% of the total number of issued Shares (excluding any treasury Shares) as at the date of passing of the resolution in relation to the General Mandate. As at the Latest Practicable Date, 62,882,739 Shares have been issued by the Company. Subject to the passing of the ordinary resolution numbered 4(A) and on the basis that no further

title: Shares are issued or repurchased after the Latest Practicable Date and up to the date of the Annual
text: General Meeting, the Company will be allowed to issue (or transfer out of the treasury) a maximum of 12,576,547 Shares. In addition, subject to a separate approval of the ordinary resolution numbered 4(C), the number of Shares purchased by the Company under ordinary resolution numbered 4(B) will also be added to extend the General Mandate as mentioned in ordinary resolution numbered 4(A) provided that such additional value shall represent up to 10% of the total number of issued Shares (excluding any treasury Shares) as at the date of passing the resolutions in relation to the General Mandate and Repurchase Mandate. The Directors wish to state that they have no immediate plans to issue any new Shares (including any sale or transfer of treasury Shares) pursuant to the General Mandate. – 5 –

title: REPURCHASE MANDATE TO REPURCHASE SHARES
text: At the annual general meeting of the Company held on May 20, 2024, an ordinary resolution

title: was passed granting a general mandate to the Directors to repurchase Shares up to a maximum of
text: 10% of the total number of the issued Shares as at the date of passing such resolution. Such mandate will lapse at the conclusion of the Annual General Meeting. In addition, an ordinary

title: Repurchase Mandate to the Directors to exercise the powers of the Company to repurchase Shares
text: representing up to 10% of the total number of issued Shares (excluding any treasury Shares) as at the date of passing of the resolution in relation to the Repurchase Mandate.

title: An explanatory statement required by the Listing Rules to be sent to the Shareholders in
text: connection with the proposed Repurchase Mandate is set out in Appendix II to this circular. This

title: make an informed decision on whether to vote for or against the relevant resolution at the Annual
text: General Meeting. As at the Latest Practicable Date, there were 62,882,739 Shares in issue. Subject to the passing of the ordinary resolution numbered 4(B) and on the basis that no further Shares to be

title: issued or repurchased after the Latest Practicable Date and up to the date of the Annual General
text: Meeting, the Company will be allowed to repurchase a maximum of 6,288,273 Shares. RE-ELECTION OF RETIRING DIRECTORS Pursuant to Article 16.19 of the Articles of Association, at every annual general meeting of the Company one-third of the Directors for the time being (or, if their number is not three or a multiple of three, then the number nearest to, but not less than, one-third) shall retire from office by rotation provided that every Director (including those appointed for a specific term) shall be subject to retirement by rotation at least once every three years. In accordance with Article 16.2 of the Articles of Association, any Director appointed to fill a

title: casual vacancy on the Board or as an addition to the existing Board shall hold office until the first
text: annual general meeting of the Company after his/her appointment and shall be eligible for re-election at that meeting. According to Article 16.19, Mr. TANG Shun Lam and Mr. ZHAO Hongqiang, both are independent non-executive Directors, will hold office as the Directors until the AGM and are subject to re-election. – 6 –

title: LETTER FROM THE BOARD
text: According to Articles 16.2, Mr. HU Xiangcheng, non-executive Director, will hold office as the Director until the AGM and is subject to re-election. Details of the above retiring Directors who are subject to re-election at the Annual General

title: Meeting are set out in Appendix I to this circular in accordance with the relevant requirements of
text: the Listing Rules.

title: Procedure and Process for Nomination of Directors
text: The Nomination Committee will evaluate, select and recommend candidate(s) for directorships to the Board by giving due consideration to criteria, having due regard to the benefits of diversity on the Board, including but not limited to gender, age, cultural and educational background, ethnicity, professional experience, skills, knowledge and length of service, sufficient time to effectively carry out their duties, their services on other listed and non-listed companies should be limited to reasonable numbers, qualifications including accomplishment and experience in the relevant industries the Company’s business is involved in, independence, reputation for integrity, potential contributions that the individual(s) can bring to the Board and commitment to enhance and maximise Shareholders’ value.

title: In accordance with the terms of reference of the Nomination Committee and the Director
text: nomination policy of the Company, the Nomination Committee has evaluated the performance and contribution of each of the retiring Directors during their tenure of office. In the evaluation, the Nomination Committee has considered the extensive experience,

title: positively to the Board with his extensive knowledge and experience in various fields that are
text: relevant to the Company’s business. In addition, the retiring Directors’ diversity of experience have enabled them to provide valuable and diverse views, as well as relevant insights to the Board and to contribute to the diversity of the Board. In addition, Mr. TANG Shun Lam and Mr. ZHAO Hongqiang, being independent non-executive Directors, have made an confirmation of independence pursuant to Rule 3.13 of the Listing Rules. The Nomination Committee assessed and reviewed the independence of the independent non-executive Directors, and is satisfied that independent non-executive Directors have the required independence to fulfil the role of an independent non-executive Director. – 7 –

title: LETTER FROM THE BOARD
text: The Board, having considered the recommendation of the Nomination Committee, has proposed the re-election of, Mr. TANG Shun Lam, Mr. ZHAO Hongqiang and Mr. HU Xiangcheng. Such proposals will be put forward at the Annual General Meeting for Shareholders’ consideration and approval by way of ordinary resolutions. The Board also believes that the Directors who are seeking re-election at the Annual General Meeting have the qualifications and

title: related expertise that will continue to generate significant contribution to the Company and the
text: Shareholders as a whole. PROPOSED RE-APPOINTMENT OF AUDITOR The consolidated financial statements of the Group for the year ended December 31, 2024

title: were audited by Forvis Mazars CPA Limited whose term of office will expire upon the Annual
text: General Meeting. The Board proposes to re-appoint Forvis Mazars CPA Limited as the auditor of the Company and to hold office until the conclusion of the next annual general meeting of the Company, and to authorise the Board to fix the remuneration of the auditor.

text: Annual General Meeting, the record date will be Wednesday, June 18, 2025 and the register of members of the Company will be closed from Friday, June 13, 2025 to Wednesday, June 18, 2025 (both days inclusive), during which no transfer of Shares will be effected. In order to be eligible to attend and vote at the AGM, all transfer of Shares, accompanied by the relevant share certificates and transfer forms, must be lodged with the Company’s branch share registrar in Hong Kong, Computershare Hong Kong Investor Services Limited at Shops 1712–1716, 17th Floor, Hopewell

title: Centre, 183 Queen’s Road East, Wanchai, Hong Kong for registration no later than 4:30 p.m. on
text: Thursday, June 12, 2025.

title: voting in person at the Annual General Meeting if they so wish and in such event the form of
text: proxy shall be deemed to be revoked.

title: There is no Shareholder who has any material interest in the proposed resolutions regarding
text: the General Mandate and Repurchase Mandate, therefore none of the Shareholders is required to abstain from voting on such resolutions. Pursuant to Rule 13.39(4) of the Listing Rules and Article 13.5 of the Articles of Association,

title: any resolution put to the vote of the Shareholders at a general meeting shall be decided on a poll
text: except where the chairman of the general meeting, in good faith, decides to allow a resolution which relates purely to a procedural or administrative matter to be voted on by a show of hands. Accordingly, each of the resolutions set out in the notice of Annual General Meeting will be taken by way of poll. On a poll, every Shareholder present in person or by proxy or, in the case of a Shareholder being a corporation, by its duly authorised representative, shall have one vote for every fully paid Share of which he/she is the holder. A Shareholder entitled to more than one vote needs not use all his/her votes or cast all the votes he/she uses in the same way. For the avoidance of doubt and for the purposes of the Listing Rules, holders of treasury Shares (if any) shall abstain from voting on matters that require shareholders’ approval at the Company’s general meetings. – 9 –

title: The Directors consider that the proposed resolutions for the granting of the General Mandate
text: to issue Shares, the Repurchase Mandate to repurchase Shares and the re-election of retiring Directors are in the interests of the Company and the Shareholders as a whole. The Directors

title: therefore recommend the Shareholders to vote in favour of all the resolutions to be proposed at the
text: Annual General Meeting.

Subject to the foregoing, the Directors may make repurchases with profits of the Company or out of a new issuance of shares made for the purpose of the repurchase or, if authorized by the Articles of Association and subject to the Companies Act, out of capital and, in the case of any premium payable on the repurchase, out of profits of the Company or from sums standing to the credit of the share premium account of the Company or, if authorized by the Articles of Association and subject to the Companies Act, out of capital. – 15 –

text: period, it might have a material adverse impact on the working capital and/or gearing position of the Company, as compared with the positions disclosed in the audited consolidated financial statements of the Company as at December 31, 2024, being the date to which the latest published audited consolidated financial statements of the Company were made up. However, the Directors do not propose to exercise the Repurchase Mandate to such an extent as would, in the circumstances, have a material adverse effect on the working capital requirements of the Company or its gearing levels which, in the opinion of the Directors, are from time to time appropriate for the Company. GENERAL None of the Directors nor, to the best of their knowledge, having made all reasonable enquiries, their respective close associates (as defined in the Listing Rules), have any present intention if the Repurchase Mandate is approved by the Shareholders, to sell any Shares to the Company. The Directors will exercise the Repurchase Mandate in accordance with the Listing Rules, the Articles of Association and the applicable laws of the Cayman Islands. The Company may cancel such repurchased Shares or hold them as treasury Shares, subject to market conditions and the Group’s capital management needs at the relevant time of the repurchases. For any treasury Shares deposited with CCASS pending resale on the Stock Exchange, the Company shall (i) procure its broker not to give any instructions to HKSCC to vote at general meetings of the Company for the treasury Shares deposited with CCASS; and (ii) in the case of dividends or distributions, withdraw the treasury Shares from CCASS, and either re-register them in its own name as treasury Shares or cancel them, in each case before the record date for the dividends or distributions, or take any other measures to ensure that it will not exercise any shareholders’ rights or receive any entitlements which would otherwise be suspended under the applicable laws if those Shares were registered in its own name as treasury Shares. As at the Latest Practicable Date, no core connected person (as defined in the Listing Rules) has notified the Company that he or she has a present intention to sell any Shares to the Company, or has undertaken not to do so, if the Repurchase Mandate is approved by the Shareholders. – 16 –

title: APPENDIX II EXPLANATORY STATEMENT
text: The Directors confirm that to the best of their knowledge and belief, neither the explanatory

title: statement nor the proposed repurchase of Shares pursuant to the Repurchase Mandate has any
text: unusual features.

title: TAKEOVERS CODE
text: If as a result of a repurchase of Shares pursuant to the Repurchase Mandate, a Shareholder’s proportionate interest in the voting rights of the Company increases, such increase will be treated as an acquisition of voting rights for the purposes of the Takeovers Code. Accordingly, a Shareholder, or a group of Shareholders acting in concert (within the meaning under the Takeovers Code), depending on the level of increase in the Shareholder’s interest, could obtain or consolidate

title: control of the Company and thereby become obliged to make a mandatory offer in accordance with
text: Rule 26 of the Takeovers Code. As at the Latest Practicable Date, according to the register kept by the Company pursuant to section 336 of the SFO and so far as is known to, or can be ascertained after reasonable enquiry by the Directors, 58.com is interested in 23,723,837 Shares, representing approximately 37.73% of the total number of Shares in issue. 58.com is wholly-owned by Quantum Bloom Group Ltd. (“Quantum Bloom”), which is controlled as to more than one-third by Mr. YAO Jinbo (through his intermediary controlled entities). Nihao Haven Corporation (“Nihao Haven”) controls over one-third interest in Quantum Bloom. Nihao Haven is wholly-owned by Nihao China Corporation (“Nihao China”) which is beneficially owned by Mr. YAO Jinbo through Credit Suisse Trust Limited as trustee. Accordingly, under the SFO, each of Quantum Bloom, Nihao Haven, Nihao China and Mr. YAO Jinbo is deemed to be interested in the entire equity interests held by 58.com in the Company. In the event that the Directors exercise in full the power to repurchase Shares under the Repurchase Mandate, then the attributable interest of 58.com would be increased from approximately 37.73% to approximately 41.92% of the total number of Shares in issue. To the best knowledge and belief of the Directors, such increase would give rise to an obligation to make a mandatory offer under the Takeovers Code. Save as aforesaid, the Directors

title: are not aware of any other consequences which may arise under the Takeovers Code as a result of
text: any repurchase of Shares pursuant to the Repurchase Mandate. The Directors have no present

title: intention to repurchase the Shares to the extent that will trigger the obligations under the
text: Takeovers Code for 58.com and Mr. YAO Jinbo to make a mandatory offer and will not effect

title: repurchases to such extent which would result in the number of Shares held by the public falling
text: below the minimum public float under the public float waiver granted by the Stock Exchange. – 17 –

title: THE ACQUISITION
text: The Board is pleased to announce that on 12 June 2025 (after trading hours), the Purchaser (being a direct wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company) and the Vendor entered into the Agreement, pursuant to which the Purchaser has conditionally agreed to acquire

title: and the Vendor has conditionally agreed to sell the Sale Shares at the Consideration of
text: HK$11,922,600, which will be satisfied by the issue of the Consideration Shares at the Issue Price in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement.

However, as the Consideration will be satisfied by the allotment and issuance of the Consideration Shares, the Acquisition constitutes a share transaction and is therefore subject to the reporting and announcement requirements under Chapter 14 of the Listing Rules. As the Completion is subject to fulfilment (or waiver, if applicable) of certain

title: INTRODUCTION
text: The Board is pleased to announce that on 12 June 2025 (after trading hours), the Purchaser (being a direct wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company) and the Vendor entered into the Agreement, pursuant to which the Purchaser has conditionally agreed to acquire

title: and the Vendor has conditionally agreed to sell the Sale Shares at the Consideration of
text: HK$11,922,600, which will be satisfied by the issue of the Consideration Shares at the Issue Price in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement.

title: The principal terms of the Agreement are set out below:
text: Date 12 June 2025 (after trading hours) Parties (i) GGEx Holdings Limited, as the Purchaser, a direct wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company; and (ii) Tam Chun Lam (譚峻霖), as the Vendor. To the best of the Directors’ knowledge, information and belief having made all reasonable enquiries, the Vendor is an Independent Third Party.

title: Assets to be acquired
text: Pursuant to the Agreement, the Purchaser has conditionally agreed to acquire and the Vendor has conditionally agreed to sell the Sale Shares, representing the entire issued share capital of the Target Company.

title: Consideration
text: Pursuant to the Agreement, the Consideration for the Acquisition shall be HK$11,922,600, which shall be settled by way of issue and allotment of 3,100,000 new Shares at the Issue Price to the Vendor upon Completion. – 2 –

title: Basis of Consideration
text: The Consideration was determined after arm’s length negotiations between the Company and the Vendor on normal commercial terms after taking into account, among others, (i) the historical financial performance of the Target Company for the year ended 31 March 2025; (ii) the financial position of the Target Company as at 31 March 2025; and (iii) the Company’s assessment of the prospects of the Group upon the Acquisition as described in the paragraph headed “Reasons for and benefits of the Acquisition”. In addition, as part of the Company’s efforts in evaluating the fairness and reasonableness of the Consideration and the valuation of the Target Company, the Company has considered the following:

title: Strategic and Technological Rationale
text: The Target Company is a Hong Kong-based software company established in 2014 with specialized capabilities in artificial intelligence (“AI”) chatbot systems, customer relationship management (“CRM”) integration, and multilingual speech-to-speech agents. The Group’s primary objective in the acquisition is to gain immediate access to the Target Company’s intellectual property, proprietary software stack, and engineering expertise, which are strategically valuable to the Group’s future AI roadmap. The acquisition of the Target Company brings several strategic advantages to the Group. The Target Company’s modular AI framework, including trained language models, multilingual natural language processing, and automation logic, can be seamlessly integrated into the Group’s digital platforms, accelerating deployment timelines and eliminating the need for system development from scratch. Additionally, the Target Company’s proprietary AI speech-to-speech agent strengthens customer-facing AI tools, particularly benefiting the Group’s logistics and customer service operations. The Target Company’s integration- ready application programming interface and cloud architecture enhance platform synergy, enabling cost savings and long-term scalability across the Group’s ecosystem. Furthermore, onboarding the Target Company’s engineering team ensures the retention of AI expertise and continuity in development. Lastly, the Target Company’s technology plays a pivotal role in advancing the Group’s global customer service centers by integrating AI-driven chatbots, voice AI, and intelligent CRM tools, significantly improving efficiency, multilingual support, and 24/7 availability. – 3 –

title: Market Benchmarking and Valuation Multiples
text: The Target Company operates in the AI software sector, particularly in enterprise automation and conversational AI. To support valuation, the Company has reviewed a basket of comparable AI-focused listed companies in the United States and Hong Kong (the “Comparable Companies”). Details of the Comparable Companies are set out in the table below: Price-to- Price-to-sale earnings Company (stock code/ticker) Ratio RatioNote (times) (times) C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE: AI) 10.8 N.M.

title: Xiao-I Corporation (Nasdaq: AIXI) 4.0 18.0
text: Beijing Fourth Paradigm Technology Co., Ltd. (HKEX: 6682) 6.4 N.M.

title: SoundHound AI, Inc. (Nasdaq: SOUN) 26.5 N.M.
text: Average 19.1 91.5 Median 11.8 91.5

title: Note:
text: N.M. stands for not meaningful. Based on the unaudited revenue of the Target Company for the year ended 31 March 2025 of approximately HK$2.88 million, the consideration for the Acquisition of HK$11,922,600 implies a price-to-sale ratio of 4.1 times and a price-to-earnings ratio of 35.2 times, which is at the lower end of the observed trading range for the Comparable Companies. Given that the Target Company has transitioned into AI-focused operations only in recent years, the above ratios are considered conservative relative to its product roadmap and anticipated scalability. – 4 –

title: Commercial Justification and Reasonableness of Valuation
text: The Company considers the consideration for the Acquisition of HK$11,922,600 to be fair and reasonable, given the Target Company’s proprietary AI software, trained models, and internal research and development efforts, which would require significant time and cost if developed independently. The integration of the Target Company’s AI engine and engineering resources is expected to generate substantial cost savings, accelerate market deployment, and enhance the Group’s core logistics and platform services with AI- driven differentiation. Additionally, the Group plans to leverage the Target Company’s AI capabilities to modernize global customer service operations, offering multilingual, real- time and scalable support. The Target Company has already achieved profitability, with an unaudited gross profit for the year ended 31 March 2025 of approximately HK$1.93 million, reflecting a price-to-earnings ratio of 35.2 times, which is considered favourable given its growth prospects and valuable intellectual property.

title: Consideration Shares
text: The Consideration Shares shall be allotted and issued pursuant to the General Mandate, credited as fully paid, and shall rank pari passu in all respects among themselves and with the Shares in issue on the date of such allotment and issue, including the right to receive all dividends and distributions which may be declared, made or paid after such allotment and issue, and will be issued free and clean of all liens, encumbrances, equities or other third party rights. The allotment and issue of the Consideration Shares under the General

title: Completion
text: Completion shall take place on or before the 3rd Business Day after the fulfilment (or waiver) of the last of the conditions as specified in the Agreement or such other date as the parties to the Agreement may agree in writing. Upon Completion, the Company will be beneficially interested in 100% of the equity interest of the Target Company and the Target Company will become a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. Accordingly, the financial results of the Target Company will be consolidated into the accounts of the Company.

title: REASONS FOR AND BENEFITS OF THE ACQUISITION
text: The Group is a major online intra-city logistics platform in Asia and its service offerings consist of platform services, enterprise services, as well as a growing range of value-added services. – 8 –

title: management and AI chatbots to improve customer interactions and optimize business
text: operations. By serving industries such as retail, manufacturing and logistics, the Target Company helps businesses improve customer engagement and operational efficiency. The Board believes the Acquisition will enhance the Group’s logistics platform by integrating AI-driven solutions and optimizing logistics operations. The Target Company’s AI expertise may also enhance the Group’s service offerings, providing a more

title: comprehensive and efficient approach to supply chain management and improving customer
text: support. Additionally, the Acquisition may provide competitive advantages and reduce operational costs through data analytics and automation, strengthening the Group’s overall business and future growth potential. In view of the above, the Board considers that (i) the Acquisition is in line with the Group’s principal businesses and its long-term development strategy; and (ii) the terms of the Agreement and the transactions contemplated thereunder are on normal commercial terms, fair and reasonable and in the interests of the Company and the Shareholders as a whole.

text: The Consideration Shares will be issued under the General Mandate approved on 20 May 2024. The maximum number of Shares that can be issued under the General Mandate is 12,570,147 Shares, being 20% of the total number of Shares in issue as at the date of the annual general meeting of the Company held on 20 May 2024, as adjusted by share consolidation effective on 25 April 2025. As at the date of this announcement, no Shares have been allotted and issued under the General Mandate. The General Mandate is sufficient for the allotment and issue of all the Consideration Shares. Accordingly, the allotment and issue of the Consideration Shares is not subject to Shareholders’ approval. The General Mandate will be utilised as to 24.66% upon the allotment and issue of all the Consideration Shares.

title: SHARE TRANSACTION IN RELATION TO THE ACQUISITION OF
text: 100% EQUITY INTERESTS IN

title: OF CONSIDERATION SHARES UNDER GENERAL MANDATE
text: Reference is made to the announcement of GOGOX Holdings Limited (the “Company”) dated 12 June 2025 (the “Announcement”) in relation to the Acquisition of 100% equity

title: interests in the Target Company involving the issue of Consideration Shares under General
text: Mandate. Unless otherwise defined, capitalised terms used herein have the same meanings as defined in the Announcement.

title: The Board would like to provide additional information regarding the Acquisition as
text: follows:

title: Basis of Consideration
text: The Consideration of HK$11,922,600 was arrived at after arm’s length negotiations between the Company and the Vendor and was determined with reference to (i) the Target Company’s unaudited revenue of approximately HK$2.88 million and unaudited net profit after tax of approximately HK$338,000 for the year ended 31 March 2025; (ii) the Company’s strategic interest in acquiring proprietary AI chatbot and speech-to-speech technologies, software assets and a capable engineering team; (iii) benchmarking against publicly listed AI and software companies in the United States and Hong Kong; and (iv) the Group’s anticipated synergy value, particularly in enhancing AI-driven customer service and internal automation capabilities. – 1 –

title: Using listed companies as valuation comparables is a standard and widely accepted
text: practice in corporate finance, especially when valuing private technology companies, for the following reasons: (i) listed companies regularly disclose financial and operational information, enabling meaningful comparisons of valuation multiples, whereas private AI/software companies typically lack publicly available data; (ii) valuations of listed companies reflect real-time investor sentiment, risk premiums and industry expectations, providing an observable and credible market-based benchmark when private transaction data is unavailable or inconsistent; (iii) although the Comparable Companies are publicly traded, they operate in the same or highly similar sectors as the Target Company; and (iv) the Company has applied conservative, lower-end multiples adjusted for the private nature of the Target Company, including factors such as illiquidity, limited scale, and restricted investor access. Such approach aligns with established valuation norms and supports a fair and objective assessment of the Target Company’s value in the absence of direct private company comparables. Based on the selection criteria above, the Company has identified and selected 8 Comparable Companies from publicly available sources. Details of the Comparable Companies are set out in under the paragraph headed “Market Benchmarking and Valuation Multiples” in the Announcement. The implied price-to-sales (“P/S”) ratio of 4.1 times of the Target Company, calculated based on the implied 100% equity value of the Target Company as deduced from the

title: Consideration for the Acquisition and the unaudited revenue the Target Company for the
text: year ended 31 March 2025 of approximately HK$2.88 million, and implied price-to-earnings (“P/E”) ratio of 35.2 times of the Target Company, calculated based on the implied 100%

The Acquisition carries strategic benefits, including the integration of reusable AI modules, acceleration of product development and the replacement of future research and development investments. The Acquisition also secures an experienced engineering team and a revenue-generating customer base. Given the above, the Company maintains a positive outlook on the Target Company’s future financial performance. Having considered the aforesaid factors, the Board (including the independent non-executive Directors) considered that taking reference to the P/S and P/E ratios of the Comparable

title: Companies is fair and reasonable and in the interests of the Company and its shareholders as
text: a whole for the purpose of the determination of the Consideration. – 3 –

title: Consideration Shares
text: The Company would like to clarify that the Issue Price of HK$3.846 represents a discount of approximately 1.38% over the average closing price of HK$3.90 per Share as quoted on the Stock Exchange for the five (5) trading days immediately prior to the Agreement.

title: Reasons for and Benefits of the Acquisition
text: The Target Company is a Hong Kong-based software development company established in 2014 that specializes in AI-driven customer service automation tools, with its core business encompasses: (i) Conversational AI chatbot systems: the Target Company develops AI-powered chatbots that handle automated customer interactions via text-based channels such as WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, and websites. These bots leverage natural language processing and contextual memory to simulate human-like responses and manage inquiries across multiple languages; (ii) Speech-to-speech AI agents: the Target Company provides real-time voice AI solutions that enable automated multilingual phone support. These tools use proprietary speech

title: recognition and synthesis technology combined with large language models to handle
text: voice-based interactions without the need for live agents; (iii) CRM and messaging integration: the Target Company offers integration tools and

title: application programming interfaces that allow businesses to embed its AI solutions
text: into their CRM platforms and communication workflows; and (iv) Commercial SaaS platform: the Target Company is the developer of DumbChat.AI Limited (“dumbChat”), a SaaS chatbot product offering plug-and-play AI customer service. The Company is currently a paying subscriber to dumbChat and uses it to automate first-line responses and inquiries across customer service channels. In addition, the Target Company operates under a recurring subscription model with additional project-based development revenue. Its clientele includes small and medium-sized enterprises and logistics clients in Hong Kong and Southeast Asia. – 4 –

title: Company is as follows:
text: (i) to gain proprietary access to conversational AI and voice assistant intellectual property; (ii) to reduce dependence on third-party vendors, such as the current dumbChat subscription; (iii) to secure a highly capable engineering team to accelerate in-house AI development; and (iv) to customize AI tools specifically for logistics operations and support workflows. The Acquisition will directly strengthen the Group’s customer service operations, which are substantial in scope. The Group operates customer service centers across multiple markets, supported by over 60 personnel across the regions. These teams manage a high volume of repetitive tasks, including order status inquiries, onboarding support, payment questions, and customer feedback handling. By integrating the Target Company’s AI technology, the Group will be able to automate a significant share of first-line customer service interactions, both text and voice, in multiple languages. This will lead to a substantial boost in efficiency, allowing the same service volume to be handled with fewer resources or improved quality, especially during peak delivery seasons. The Group also expects to reduce overall customer service costs by relying less on headcount, accelerating issue resolution, and offering 24/7 self-service support. The Target Company’s flexible AI stack can be integrated into both driver-facing and shipper-facing interfaces, improving user experience and operational productivity. Furthermore, the AI engineering talent within the Target Company can directly support the Group in developing and deploying bespoke AI-driven applications tailored to its logistics operations, further driving automation and competitive differentiation. According to industry benchmarks, companies that adopt conversational AI typically achieve significant savings in customer service costs. For instance, Vodafone reported a substantial drop in cost per chat, while Klarna replaced the equivalent of a significant number of agents with AI-driven tools. Ultimately, the Acquisition supports the Group’s broader strategy for long-term digital transformation and margin expansion through AI-driven operational leverage within its logistics platform business. – 5 –

title: Confirmation
text: Pursuant to Main Board Rule 13.25C / GEM Rule 17.27C, we hereby confirm to the best knowledge, information and belief that, in relation to each issue of shares or sale or transfer of treasury shares as set out in Section I, it has been duly authorised by the board of directors of the listed issuer and carried out in compliance with all applicable listing rules, laws and other regulatory requirements and, insofar as applicable: (Note 7) (i) all money due to the listed issuer in respect of the issue of shares, or sale or transfer of treasury shares has been received by it; (ii) all pre-conditions for listing imposed by the Rules Governing the Listing of Securities on The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited under \"Qualifications of listing\" have been fulfilled; (iii) all (if any) conditions contained in the formal letter granting listing of and permission to deal in the securities have been fulfilled; (iv) all the securities of each class are in all respects identical (Note 8); (v) all documents required by the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance to be filed with the Registrar of Companies have been duly filed and that compliance has been made with all other legal requirements; (vi) all the definitive documents of title have been delivered/are ready to be delivered/are being prepared and will be delivered in accordance with the terms of issue, sale or transfer; (vii) completion has taken place of the purchase by the issuer of all property shown in the listing document to have been purchased or agreed to be purchased by it and the purchase consideration for all such property has been duly satisfied; and (viii) the trust deed/deed poll relating to the debenture, loan stock, notes or bonds has been completed and executed, and particulars thereof, if so required by law, have been filed with the Registrar of Companies.

title: Notes to Section I:
text: 1. Please insert the closing balance date of the last Next Day Disclosure Return published pursuant to Main Board Rule 13.25A / GEM Rule 17.27A or Monthly Return pursuant to Main Board Rule 13.25B / GEM Rule 17.27B, whichever is the later. 2. Please set out all changes in issued shares or treasury shares requiring disclosure pursuant to Main Board Rule 13.25A / GEM Rule 17.27A together with the relevant dates of changes. Each category will need to be disclosed individually with sufficient information to enable the user to identify the relevant category in the listed issuer's Monthly Return. For example, multiple issues of shares as a result of multiple exercises of share options under the same share option scheme or of multiple conversions under the same convertible note must be aggregated and disclosed as one category. However, if the issues resulted from exercises of share options under 2 share option schemes or conversions of 2 convertible notes, these must be disclosed as 2 separate categories. 3. The percentage change in the number of issued shares (excluding treasury shares) of the listed issuer is to be calculated by reference to the opening balance of the number of issued shares (excluding treasury shares) being disclosed in this Next Day Disclosure Return.
